Designed to offer the fine-tuned, customized feel of a precision target stock, the PRS is adjustable for both comb height and length-of-pull without sacrificing the durability necessary to withstand the operational environment. Compared to the A2 stock, the PRS can shorten LOP by .25" or extend it by .75" as well as provide three-quarters of an inch of comb height adjustment. Machined aluminum adjustment knobs feature positive-locking click detents to maintain position under recoil and allows easy, tool-less adjustments by simply rotating the knobs. Aluminum butt-plate and alloy steel adjustment shafts provide stability and strength to withstand severe impact conditions. Rubber butt-pad offers positive shoulder purchase to prevent slippage for optimal accuracy even with body armor or modular gear. Bottom Picatinny-type rail allows for monopod use, additional sling mounts or storage. Stock includes all mounting hardware for A1/A2 type rifles with fixed stock.

These characteristics, combined with the extreme ruggedness and reliability of every Nightforce riflescope, make them ideal for even the largest calibers. The slim profile of the 5.5-22 x 50 NXS makes it easily adaptable to a wide range of mounting systems. Its superb resolution at high magnification opens an entirely new world of extended range shooting for the accomplished marksman; Nightforce shooters are now accurately reaching to 2000 yards and beyond.
($2400 w/ rings)

GG&G bipod $220

title: For Sale:  3 Steyr Mannlicher M95 (M1895) rifles (Austro-Hungary)
location: Mountain Island Lake Area, Charlotte, North Carolina
postcontent:
None of the rifles are in working condition. One of the rifles is the converted shorter model. I am asking $360 for all three. I have seen models in working condition priced at around $375 each. I have included a description from "World Guns" below.


The Steyr M1895 rifle, also known as Steyr-Mannlicher M95 straight pull rifle, was developed by famous Austrian arms designer Ferdinand Ritter Von Mannlicher. Based on his previous M1890 design, this rifle was manufactured in Austro-Hungarian Empire at state arms factories in Steyr (Austria) and Budapest (Hungary). More than 3 millions of M95 rifles were produced between 1895 and 1918. This rifle was issued to Austro-Hungarian army, and, after the fall of the Empire, to the Austrian and Hungarian armies. Originally produced in 8x50R caliber, in 1924 some of M95 rifles were converted to the German 7.92x57 Mauser (also known as 8x57 Mauser) ammunition. These converted rifles featured shorter 58 cm barrels, were designated as M95/24 and used in Yugoslavia and Bulgaria. This conversion gave away with original Mannlicher en bloc clip, and replaced it with Mauser stripper clips. Since 1930 Austria converted most of the M95 rifles to the more powerful 8x56R M30 ammunition, using the same Mannlicher en bloc clips. These rifles were designated as M95/30, and marked with the letter "S" on the receiver ring. Hungary started to convert their rifles to the same 8x56R ammunition in 1931, with the upgraded rifles being marked with the letter "H" on the receiver ring. Many of the M95 rifles were used during the Word War 2 by the Hungarian, Bulgarian and Italian armies, as well as by some German police forces.

title: For Sale:  TTE Group Tactical Carbine I - Oct 27/28, 2012 - Denver CO
postcontent:
Class Description: TTE Group's "Tactical Carbine I" class is designed to introduce shooters to a set of 10 tactical shooting standards based on materials from MSG Paul Howe (RET), the owner of Combat Shooting and Tactics. Using a set of diagnostic drills, shooting standards and tactical application modules, you'll leave the course with a set of quantifiable, qualitative skills to provide you with a baseline of performance to improve your shooting and diagnose accuracy and speed issues. Some of the standards and modules will help you learn skills such as proper rifle employment, transitions, recoil management, multiple target engagement, precision shooting, shooting on the move, and other items.

Prerequisites: This class is best attended by shooters who already have attained a basic skill set with their rifle and are ready to move to the next level. Both beginning and advanced students will find materials to improve the abilities and to help diagnose shooting issues.

Equipment Needed:

- Rifle with 3 magazines (5 or more suggested, and backup weapon is never a bad idea)
- Pistol with 3 magazines (5 or more suggested, and backup weapon is never a bad idea)
- Quality Belt with holster and magazine pouches (quality Kydex such as CompTac, Raven Concealment, Bladetech suggested) SOFT NYLON HOLSTERS ARE STRONGLY DISCOURAGED FOR SAFETY REASONS.
- Belt pouches to carry pistol and rifle magazines are recommended
- 1000rds of rifle ammo
- 200rds of pistol ammo
- Rifle Sling (1 or 2 point, but NO 3-POINT SLINGS, NO CARRY STRAPS)
- Weapon cleaning kit (cleaning rod, bore brushes, patches, rags, cleaning & lubricating oil, toothbrush)
- Hat, Rain or inclement weather gear
- Wraparound Eye and ELECTRONIC Ear protection IS MANDATORY
- Water / Snacks (we’ll take an hour lunch break around noon, but we do NOT LEAVE THE RANGE)
- Sun Screen (non-greasy or water resistant recommended)

I suggest that you wear comfortable shoes, and clothing that you don’t
mind getting dirty.

Instructor: Kelly Hohnholz received his pistol instructor and shoothouse/cqb instructor certification from MSG Paul Howe (RET) at CSAT and his training and instruction resume is available on request.

COST: 200.00 - PAYABLE BY CHECK, MONEY ORDER OR PAYPAL.

Kansas CCH Class
 $50 Lunch included
 Cash / Check Accepted

August 4th 10A.M.
August 18th 10A.M.

Certified CCH Instructor
NRA Instructor

By completing this class you will then be eligible to apply for your Kansas Carry Conceal License through the Attorney General’s office.

The class covers CCH law, Use of Force, Basic Marksmanship, Care and Maintenance, Weapon Selection, Holster Selection, Methods of Carry, Self Defense, and Interaction with Law Enforcement. 

There is a written exam along with a shooting test. You don't need to worry about either test as I give you everything you will need to pass them both during the 8 hour course. 

I have no minimums on my classes and will NOT cancel them because I don't have enough people for the class. One person is all it takes.

You can bring your own pistol for the shooting portion along with 50 rounds of ammunition. I recommend using a .22 however any caliber is accepted. If you don't have a pistol yet or would just like to borrow mine I have a .22 Ruger.

If you have any questions or to sign up call, text, or email me at 316-250-3990, Elliott.firearms@gmail.com

postcontent:
WTS:

(1) Spikes Tactical 11.5" SAR AR15 Upper Receiver w/ Dynacomp Shorty

Components Include:

Mil-Spec Upper Receiver w/ Port Door, Forward Assist & M4 Feedramps

Vltor Low-Profile Set Screw .625 Gas Block - Dimpled
Carbine Length Gas Tube & Pin
AR15 Charging Handle

NO BCG Included - We have Mil-Spec M16 Nitride Coated Bolt Carrier Groups on hand at this time and will add to build - headspace & test fire on request (contact us for pricing)

$649 FTF Cash - (Accept CC - Paypal as well - contact me)

Retail value on this upper is $770 w/ the Dynacomp. Top notch components at cost. PM/Email me below and we'll make arrangements.

Owner @ ARchitects15.com

Mil-Spec Upper Receiver w/ Port Door, Forward Assist & M4 Feedramps

Machined from a 7075 T6 Mil-Spec Forging with Mil-Spec Type III Hardcoat Anodized finish, T-markings and M4 feed ramps. Complete with forward assist and ejection door.

11.5" 1:7 Twist, Cold Hammer Forged Lightweight M249 CL HP MP Barrel w/ .625" diameter gas block seat

These Amazing CHF barrels are extremely durable with a 20,000+ round service life. These CHF barrels are turned to ST's lightweight barrel Profile. It weighs 18oz with M4 Barrel extension and no FSB on the 11.5" Barrel. The barrels have a .625" gas block seat with a properly sized gas port and the muzzle is threaded perfectly concentric with 1/2x28 threads. These CHF barrels are made to the Mil-Spec for the M249 SAW. The Cold Hammer Forging process Work Hardens the steel around a rifled mandrel, which creates the lands and grooves. These barrels are chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 Twist Rate. The barrel blanks are the correct Certified CMV material and they are also Hard Chrome lined to the M249 SAW Mil-Spec, which is almost twice as thick as the Hard Chrome on a Mil-Spec M4. The End Result is a Rifle that can be Run Hard Day after Day! Each barrel is HPT and MPI. They have Mil-Spec M4 barrel extensions, Mil-Spec Phosphate finish on the outside.

Spike's Tactical Dynacomp Extreme Shorty

Spike's Tactical Dynacomp Extreme muzzle break reduces felt recoil and helps combat muzzle climb. These muzzle breaks are Manufactured 303 Stainless Steel and feature a Melonited black finish for wear resistance from high volume shooting. Machined to be completely concentric, included threading, not taped after the fact. The ports are ball dimpled for optimal expansion of gases and heat dissipation.

Features:

Threaded for 1/2x28” barrels
Machined from 303 Stainless Steel
Black Melonite finish
Ball dimpled expansion ports
Includes Crush Washer

Spike's Tactical 9" SAR Rail

The Spike's Tactical SAR rail system is a lightweight 1-piece quad rail. Sharing many of the same characteristics of the appealing Spike's BAR rail, the SAR rail is even lighter. Each component is manufactured to precise tolerances for a firm fit and reliable service.

Features

Extruded Unibody
(4) QD Sockets
Type III Anodized Hardcoat Finish
Scalloped rails for operator comfort
Anti-rotation system
Welded mounting system
Weight of 9.31oz

Vltor .625 Set Screw Gas Block

With the various rail systems currently being offered for the AR15/M16/M4 weapon systems, the Vltor Low-Profile Gas Block is small enough to fit inside most rail systems. The Vltor Low-Profile Gas Block covers one-inch of the barrels surface and is made to the tightest tolerance. These gas blocks are offered in 17-4PH stainless steel.

title: For Sale:  1905 S&W .38cal Pistol
postcontent: S&W .38 Spl Military & Police Model of 1905 2nd Change Fair Bead Blast Oklahoma Estate Revolver ca 1907. This specimen has been bead blasted down to its gray metal, but with some rust appearing forward of the trigger guard. Residual surface pitting is extensive, as the photos show. We rate this M&P as only fair / refinish, since about 30 percent of its surfaces show light to moderate pitting. Mechanical condition is similar: bore and cylinder chambers are affected by very light pitting. Timing, action and lockup are quite good, but there is about 3mm of lateral play to the cylinder, and that part has pronounced endshake. Note that the grips are good, no cracks, and they appear to be original. There are some mechanical; problems with this gun and it will need to be gone over by a competent gunsmith to insure that this gun is safe. Once fixed it should be a nice shooter and to have around the house for protection.

title: For Sale/Trade:  EAA WITNESS .45 ACP & .22 COMBO TANGFOLIO 999119
postcontent:
Up for sale a used EAA Witness 45/22 combo. This is the all steel blued version. I have owned this gun about 3 years and am the original owner. Purchased at Golden Triangle Guns in Tavares FL. Includes case, all paperwork, (2) 10RD .45 mags, (1) .22 10RD mag, (2) slides one for the .45 and one for the .22. Gun is 98% with about 1,000 rounds through it. It has been in my safe for the past couple of years since I have moved to shooting .40 S&W and 9MM. As I stated earlier this is the all steel not the Polymer model.

EAA Pistols are manufactured in Italy by Tangfolio, they are distributed by EAA/US Sporting Goods Inc of Rockledge FL. They are based on the CZ 75 series pistols. Their website is www.eaacorp.com . MSRP is $640.00, you can find them on the net between 500-600 dollars, the all steel models are harder to find, a lot are the Poly models. I have nothing but the highest regard for EAA pistols.

Features:

Gun can be converted to 10MM or 38 Super with purchase of Slide and barrel Assembly

Stainless barrels on both .45 and .22

Capacity 10+1 both calibers

Finish Blued carbon steel

Black Rubber grips, aftermarket grips available in a wide variety

Windage adjustable sights rear, fixed blade front

DA/SA recoil operated

Barrel Length 4.5"

Overall Length 8.1"

Weight empty 33 ounces

Safety Frame mounted sear block, firing pin block. Can be carried cocked and locked like a 1911

The .22 slide and barrel will also fit the Witness 10MM and 38 Super.

Here is an excerpt from Jeff Quinn of Gunblast.com:

The EAA Witness is a fine pistol, available in many different configurations, and chambered for our most popular pistol cartridges, plus the excellent but less popular 38 Super and 10mm Auto cartridges. The EAA Witness is a world-class fighting pistol, and I highly recommend it.

Buyer must be willing to meet FTF in or around the Leesburg FL area. I can travel up to 30 miles. Buyer must be willing to sign transfer bill of sale. Buyer must have a valid ID, prefer CWP holder. 

Would consider trades for the following weapons only, Would pay cash for your higher priced gun with my trade.

title: For Sale:  Extremely rare Lignose Einhand 2A
postcontent:
These are very hard to find and rarely come up for sale. The German Lignose Einhand pistols were produced in the 1920s and have one very interesting feature: the trigger guard is movable and can be used to cock the gun with one hand ("Einhand" means "one hand" in German). 

The cocking mechanism is very smooth and natural feeling.

This particular gun functions and shoots great.

There is a large amount of the original finish left on the gun, with the right side having a bit more wear than the left. The top of the right grip does have a chip in it (perfect reproductions can be bought online at http://vintagegungrips.net/lignose.html ), but otherwise the condition is pretty good for one of these rarities.

Barrel and bore are both good.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Paratrooper SKS
postcontent:
I have a chinese paratrooper sks in all original condition.  It has a low round count and the cleaning kit is still in the butt stock.  The particular sks is from factory 26 which is one of the best and well known factories.  The barel length on a paratrooper is only 16 inches which is much shorter than rugular sks's and these shorter versions are much harder to find.  It has a milled trigger group which ive personally not seen on any sks's that ive came across.   

The only thing holding this rifle back from being considered in excellent condition is a small amount of light pitting below the wood line on the reciever.  This pitting is only cosmetic and will not hinder the rifles performance.  It has been reblued over by the previous owner.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Taurus PT92 stainless
postcontent:
I have for trade a Taurus PT92 stainless in 9mm. It has a set of custom pau ferro wood grips w/Taurus medallion. One factory 15rd mag and one 18rd MecGar teflon coated Mag. No Box.

For those of you not familiar with these, its a Clone of the Beretta 92 series. This gun is identical almost every way to a Beretta 92 except it has a frame mounted Saftey/Decocker. If you like 1911's its set up the same way except the safty also acts as the decocker if depressed to its second notch. You can run this gun cocked and locked like a 1911 or in double action only like a Beretta. Its been totally reliable for me with anything its been fed and is more accurate than im able to shoot it. The only reason im trading it is that i just purchased a Beretta 92fs.

I'd prefer to do straight trade for a entry level 1911 (ATI, Rock Island, Auto ordnance) I'm also interested in other handguns....glocks...xd.....S&W...colt. I'm in the market for a Keltec Sub 2000. I have cash to add if needed. I may be interested in long guns but it just depends on what you have....so just let me know what you have?
